gov.usgs.anss.edgeoutput

Class ChannelInfrastructure

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.edgeoutput.ChannelInfrastructure

  • public class ChannelInfrastructure
extends java.lang.Object
    This calls reads from a edge created output buffer and keeps the data sorted into channels. It manages to keep a predefined amount of data per channel and support access classes to implement a "wait for time" release (that is the consumer specifies a time its willing to wait for the next packet on the channel and when that expires is willing to take the next oldest.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChannelInfrastructure

        public ChannelInfrastructure(java.lang.String nm,
                     int secD,
                     int minrc,
                     java.lang.Class defSub,
                     int wait,
                     EdgeThread parent)
        Creates a new instance of ChannelInfrastructure
        Parameters:
        nm - The name to refer to this channel infrastructure. (often a ring file name)
        secD - The seconds of depth in the wait-for-the-bus algorithm (max time to wait for old data to fill in)
        minrc - The mininum number of records of depth
        defSub - The class that will be processing this data as output. A new one of these is created as new channels are found.
        wait - Number of seconds to wait by default in the defSub constructor.
        parent - The logging parent
